conclusion: Plan to analyze the graph to determine when the object's velocity is at its maximum.
Graph shows acceleration vs. time: starts at 2 m/s² at t = 0, increases linearly to 0 m/s² at t = 2 s, decreases to -2 m/s² at t = 4 s.
Object starts from rest, initial velocity is 0 m/s.
Acceleration is positive from t = 0 to t = 2 s, then becomes negative.
Maximum acceleration occurs at t = 2 s where acceleration is 0 m/s².
Velocity is at its maximum when acceleration is zero, meaning velocity no longer changes.
Since the object starts from rest, maximum velocity occurs at t = 2 s.
The object's velocity is at its maximum at t = 2 s.
